**Personal information we collect and why we collect it.

**

We collect your personal information for different purposes.

We collect information that you provide to us when opening an account or
registering at the website expressing an interest in obtaining information
about us or our products and services, when participating in activities on the
Services or otherwise contacting us.

Please be informed that in some cases,
providing some personal information will be required to use our services.

This relates in
particular to your email address (if you decide to register the account) and
information you provide while using our services.

The information that we collect depends on the context of your interactions
with the website and the Services, the choices you make and the products and
features you use.

The personal information we collect can include but is not
limited to the following:

    1.

Information provided by you – we collect data provided by you when using our services, that includes name, surname, email address, phone number, address, information you introduced to our tools (professional experience, information about your current and past employment and etc), but also collected information from other similar data.
Credentials – we collect passwords, password hints and similar security information used for authentication and account access.
Information automatically collected- we may collect certain information when you visit, use or navigate the website and the Services.

This information may include device and usage information, such as your IP address, browser and device characteristics, operating system, language preferences, referring URLs, device name, country, location information about how and when you use our Services and other technical information.

We may allow selected third parties to use tracking
technology on the Services, which will enable them to collect data about how
you interact with the Services over time.

We automatically
enrol into the newsletter when you place an order and provide your email
address unless you opt-out by contacting us.

You also may sign up without ordering by
requesting to receive the newsletter(s) from our websites and providing your
name and email address.

The PDPA prohibits data
users from collecting and processing a data subject’s personal data without
his or her consent.

It requires data users to inform data subjects on the purpose of its
data collection, the class of third party who may have access to the data, and
the choices that data subjects have on how the data is to be used.

**Sharing your personal information**

Unless you indicate to us that you are not interested in receiving information
regarding other products and services, your name, email address, and/or other
contact information may be shared with a third party in order to present these
offers to you.

We may share your data with third-party vendors, service providers,
contractors or agents who perform services for us or on our behalf and require
access to such information to do that work.

We may allow selected third parties to use tracking
technology on the Services, which will enable them to collect data about how
you interact with the Services over time.

We may also share your information with third parties if the activity is
understood to be illegal, fraudulent or posts a potential threat to security.

Unless described in this Policy, we do not share, any of your information with
third parties for their promotional purposes.

The Malaysian data protection
laws applies to ensure the safety of your data, we have contracts in place
with third parties who we share personal information and have instructed them
to hold your data securely and use it only for the purpose set out in the
contract.

The Act also prohibits data users from disclosing or
making its data available to any third party without the consent of data
subjects.

It requires data users to inform data subjects on the purpose of its
data collection, the class of third party who may have access to the data, and
the choices that data subjects have on how the data is to be used.
